back: Representation of a set of signals (or vectors) in terms of an orthonormal basis.
A set of vectors are linearly dependent if any of the vectors can be written as a linear combination of the others.
A set of vectors that is not linearly dependent. None of the vectors can be written as a linear combination of the other vectors.

Given a matrix $\mathbf{M}$, the rank is equal to the maximum number of linearly independent columns (or, equivalently, the maximum number of linearly independent rows). It is denoted by $\operatorname{rank} \mathbf{M}$.
A matrix with the maximum possible rank, which is equal to the minimum of the number of rows and the number of columns.
